nt_bdr wrote:
> I have set up Heretrix to crawl roughly around 100 domains. One of the
> domains in the seed has a huge number of redirect links (301's). 
> Upon looking at my crawl output I am seeing that there are 1,244
> "successful" pages out of 77,936 pages crawled for this domain.All the
> rest seem to be 301 redirects. In this case I would have expected to
> see a similar (approx 77,000) number of 200 responses that would have
> been crawled.
> Any ideas on why the "successful" page count is so low in this case?

Some theories:

- They might all be redirects to a small number of target pages (like a 
login page)
- They might be redirects to out-of-scope URLs (which are ignored).

Are a large number of URLs pending in the queue for the target domain?

- Gordon @ IA
